articles.title: Greetings to ANC of South Africa
articles.content:
Greetings to ANC of South Africa
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Saturday sent a congratulatory message to the National Executive Committee of the African National Congress (ANC) of South Africa on its 105th birthday.
					 The message said that the ANC had led to victory the protracted struggle of the South African people to oppose colonialism and put an end to the apartheid after its foundation.
					
					 It wished the ANC bigger successes in its work for the country's independent development and prosperity, expressing belief that the friendly relations between the WPK and the ANC, established in the struggle for independence against imperialism, would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Posters Encouraging Army and People Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
Posters Encouraging Army and People Produced in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Posters were produced in the DPRK to encourage the army and people in the struggle to carry through the tasks set forth by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address.
					 A poster "Let us carry through the militant tasks set forth in the New Year Address!" calls upon all servicepersons and civilians to stage a dynamic all-out general advance this year under the uplifted banner of the self-development-first principle by depicting people from all walks of life in the new year march to win greater victory.
					
					 A poster "Let us accelerate the victorious advance of socialism with the great spirit of self-reliance and self-development as the dynamic force!" emphasizes that the might of self-reliance and self-development precisely means the force of science and technology and the shortcut to implementing the five-year strategy for national economic development is to give importance and precedence to science and technology.

articles.title: Intangible Heritages Newly Registered in DPRK
articles.content:
Intangible Heritages Newly Registered in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- 13 objects were newly registered as national and local intangible heritages of the DPRK.
					 In this regard, Om Won Ho, a head of office of the National Authority for the Protection of Cultural Heritage, told KCNA:
					
					 Cultural heritages created by our ancestors are regarded as national treasures, thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea's policy on preserving the nation's cultural heritage.
					
					 The newly-registered national intangible heritages are the folk tale about Uljimundok, legend about the Altair and the Vega, silkworm culture, papermaking technology of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392), fruit punch, terrapin dish, sweet rice, Sinsollo (dish in cooking brazier), tangogi soup of North and South Hamgyong provinces and starch noodle of Hamhung in South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 And "Song of Walls in Mt. Jongbang", sweating in stone-bathroom and psammotherapy were registered as local intangible heritages.

articles.title: Fishermen of DPRK Determined to Make Big Fish Hauls
articles.content:
Fishermen of DPRK Determined to Make Big Fish Hauls
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Upon receiving the New Year Address made by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, officials and fishermen under the Ministry of Fisheries in the DPRK are firmly determined to make big fish hauls this year.
					 Pak In Gon, a department director of the ministry, told KCNA:
					
					 Officials of the ministry went down to fishery stations in the east and west coastal areas of the country from the outset of the year, in hearty response to the New Year Address.
					
					 The ministry has improved the organization and direction of production to bring about a big fish haul this year in the spirit of struggle displayed by the fishermen under the Korean People's Army who created the history of unprecedented fish haul. 
					
					 And all the fishery stations are making full preparations for catching fishes.
					
					 Taking the lead in it are the Sinpho Pelagic Fishery Complex and Mundok, Hanchon and Kamapho fishery stations.
					
					 The ministry will concentrate its efforts on putting the fishing industry on a scientific basis, increase the number of days spent for fishing at all fisheries and persistently push forward the aquatic farming.

articles.title: Coal Production Goes Up in DPRK
articles.content:
Coal Production Goes Up in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Coal miners are increasing the production from the beginning of this year, in hearty response to the New Year Address made by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 According to data available at the Ministry of Coal Industry, they produced over 22 000 more tons of coal as of January 5, as compared with against the same period of last year.
					
					 Taking the lead in this campaign are the Sunchon Area Youth Coal-mining Complex and Tokchon, Pukchang, Tukjang, Kaechon, Anju, Kangdong and Hamnam area coal mining complexes.

articles.title: Great National Unity Called for
articles.content:
Great National Unity Called for
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The entire Korean nation is pervaded with confidence and enthusiasm to certainly open up a broad avenue to independent reunification this year, greatly encouraged by the idea of national reunification set forth by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address.
					 His New Year Address calls upon all Koreans to pool their will and efforts to usher in a heyday of the nationwide reunification movement.
					
					 In order to usher in a heyday of national reunification movement, all the Korean people in the north and the south and abroad should achieve solidarity, make concerted efforts and unite on the principle of subordinating everything to national reunification, the common cause of the nation, and revitalize the reunification movement on a nationwide scale.
					
					 The cause of national reunification itself is the cause of re-linking the blood ties of the nation and achieving the national unity.
					
					 Nothing is more important than achieving the great national unity to hasten the national reunification.
					
					 The Korean nation has a good experience in achieving the unity for national reunification, its common interests, and carving out the destiny on the basis of it.
					
					 It made a breakthrough in the barrier of division, which had lasted more than half a century, in the June 15 era of reunification and turned the north-south relations of distrust and confrontation into those of reconciliation and unity and thus revitalized the reunification movement.
					
					 Dialogue and cooperation got brisk, national independence and cooperation became a trend of the times and the structure of confrontation on the Korean peninsula turned into that between the entire Korean nation and the U.S.
					
					 Events for reunification involving compatriots from the north and the south and abroad took place with splendor and shouts of slogan "Korea is one!" resounded forth from Mt. Paektu to Mt. Halla as if reflecting the common will of the Koreans.
					
					 In order to pool the will and efforts of the entire nation to usher in a heyday of the nationwide reunification movement, it is important to promote brisk contact and exchange among the fellow countrymen, irrespective of differences in ideology and system, region and ism, and classes and social strata, and hold a pan-national grand meeting for reunification involving all the political parties and organizations in the north and the south including the authorities as well as compatriots of all strata from home and abroad. It is necessary to readily join hands with anyone who prioritizes the fundamental interests of the nation and is desirous of the improved north-south relations.
					
					 However, in the past, the south Korean authorities paid no heed to the DPRK's proposals for holding a nationwide grand meeting for reunification several times and committed shameful treachery against independence and great unity while persistently resorting to the reckless military provocation and sanctions in collusion with outsiders.
					
					 Great national unity means national reunification and a reunified power.
					
					 Foreign forces, who have fished in troubled waters after bisecting Korea into two parts, never wish to see Korea get reunified to grow stronger.
					
					 The Koreans should not allow outsiders to block their reconciliation and unity and whip up national division and estrangement by inciting distrust and hostility between them and any act of following them.
					
					 When reunified, our country will demonstrate its grandeur as a dignified world power with a population of 80 million and enormous national power, a nation with advanced civilization leading the world thanks to its strong national spirit and resourcefulness, and a powerful nation of justice promoting peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 All Koreans will certainly usher in a heyday of the national reunification movement with the might of great national unity this year marking the 45th anniversary of the historic July 4 Joint Statement and the 10th anniversary of the October 4 Declaration, by embodying the patriotic idea of the peerlessly great man clearly showing the road of independent reunification.

articles.title: Self-reliance and Self-development, Dynamic Force for Victorious Advance of Socialism
articles.content:
Self-reliance and Self-development, Dynamic Force for Victorious Advance of Socialism
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has waged a dynamic drive for building a powerful socialist country, displaying over the world its might and dignity as a nuclear power, a military giant, in the East which no enemy, however formidable, would dare to provoke.
					 This proud reality would have been unthinkable without the spirit of self-reliance and self-development that one is the master of one's own destiny and one should hew out one's destiny by one's own efforts.
					
					 The glorious history of the ever-victorious Korean revolution was pioneered and advanced with the spirit of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 It was thanks to this spirit that the Korean people made Yanji bombs in thick forests to beat down the Japanese imperialists during the anti-Japanese revolutionary war and won the victory in the three year-long Fatherland Liberation War against the U.S. and its vassal forces to defend the sovereignty of the country.
					
					 With this spirit, they carried out the task of the socialist industrialization within 14 years after the war and opened up an era of great creation and prosperity, smashing the hostile forces' moves to stifle the DPRK and their heinous economic blockade upon it century after century.
					
					 The world was struck with admiration for the DPRK's successful launch of the earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4 and static firing test of new-type high-thrust motor of the launch vehicle for a geostationary satellite last year.
					
					 Fully-automated, model production systems of our own style were established and high-yielding strains were bred. And numerous industrial establishments and cooperative farms registered the proud success of surpassing the peak-year level and the Korean People's Army stood in the vanguard in adding lustre to the history of "gold seas". A miraculous victory was brought about in the campaign to heal the aftereffects of flood that hit the northern areas of North Hamgyong Province.
					
					 All these achievements made by the DPRK people during the 70-day and 200-day campaigns conducted last year prove that it is the one and only way for them to follow the road of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address set forth the militant slogan "Let Us Accelerate the Victorious Advance of Socialism with the Great Spirit of Self-reliance and Self-development as the Dynamic Force!"
					
					 The DPRK people will as ever hold higher the banner of self-reliance and self-development and achieve greater successes in the struggle for building a powerful socialist country and thus turn a heyday in the revolution into a great golden age.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Derides Japan's Bid for Permanent Member of UNSC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Derides Japan's Bid for Permanent Member of UNSC
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Japanese Prime Minister Abe talked a string of rubbish at a seminar to mark the 60th anniversary of Japan's accession to the UN that the reform of the UN Security Council is a priority task and if Japan becomes a permanent member of the UN, it will creditably fulfill its responsibility.
					 Commenting on his nonsensical talk, Rodong Sinmun Saturday ridicules Abe's despicable bid to get a permanent membership of the UNSC and get involved in the world politics together with the U.S.
					
					 As far as Japan is concerned, it does not have elementary qualifications to hold a responsible post of the UN handling international issues, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Japan has a crime-woven history as it provoked wars of aggression and committed hideous crimes against humanity in the first half of the 20th century. It is the only country in the world which is persistently denying and distorting its past crimes.
					
					 Japan is, therefore, mentioned in the article dealing with "enemy state" specified by the UN Charter. It is an "enemy state" as it was hostile to those countries which signed the Charter during World War II.
					
					 This legally disqualified and morally vulgar country is eying a responsible post of the world body. It is a mockery of the world people and a challenge to the human conscience.
					
					 Once Japan is allowed to get permanent membership of the UNSC, as claimed by Abe, the Asia-Pacific region will turn into shambles of a war.
					
					 No matter how desperately Japan may try to look tall, while clinging to the coattail of the U.S., it can never get rid of its plight as a political dwarf.

articles.title: National Unity Is Driving Force for Reunification Movement: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
National Unity Is Driving Force for Reunification Movement: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- To pool the will and efforts of the whole nation is the intrinsic requirement of the movement for national reunification and the inevitable prerequisite for strengthening the driving force for reunification on the basis of patriotism, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in an article.
					 Noting that all Koreans in the north, the south and abroad should unite close under the banner of patriotism to achieve national reunification, the article goes on:
					
					 The cause of national reunification is for rejoining the blood ties of the nation artificially divided by outside forces and uniting as a homogeneous nation. The great national unity leads to national reunification.
					
					 It is possible to frustrate the persistent challenges of the reactionary separatist forces at home and abroad only when the powerful driving force for national reunification is built by achieving great national unity.
					
					 All Koreans at home and abroad are the driving force for national reunification. No foreign forces are willing to help reunify Korea. It is the bitter lesson in the distress-torn history of the Korean nation that a nation goes to ruin when it depends on outsiders. The Korean nation, which has a history spanning five thousand years, was divided into two and has suffered agony of separation for the last several decades owing to foreign forces.
					
					 Our nation should depend on its own efforts only in the struggle for carving out its destiny. The wisdom and efforts of our nation are the dynamic force to greet a new morning of national reunification. 
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south and abroad should closely unite under the banner of patriotism irrespective of differences in their ideologies, ideals and systems on the principle of subordinating everything to national reunification, common cause of the nation, and strengthen the driving force of patriotism for reunification and dynamically push forward the reunification movement with its might.

articles.title: DPRK Will Make Efforts to Ensure Genuine Int'l Justice: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Will Make Efforts to Ensure Genuine Int'l Justice: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- It is the firm stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government to get firmly united with those countries championing independence and make concerted efforts with them to ensure genuine international justice, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in an article.
					 The DPRK protected justice with its tremendous military muscle, adhering to the anti-imperialist independent stand and principle of socialism without slightest vacillation when not a few countries abandoned principle, compromised and submitted to injustice, yielding to the U.S. military pressure and arbitrary practices, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The imperialists left no stone unturned in blocking the advance of the DPRK, the bulwark of independence and justice, and stifling Korean-style socialism. They slapped international sanctions and blockade against the DPRK and escalated the moves for aggression after listing it as a target of preemptive nuclear attack. 
					
					 But they could not provoke the DPRK even a bit as it emerged a military power with the might of Songun.
					
					 Had the DPRK failed to take measures for building up its powerful military muscle, counting on others, it would not have been able to frustrate the heinous moves of the imperialists for aggression and defend the country's sovereignty and international justice.
					
					 No matter how the international situation and the structure of relations with neighboring countries may change, the DPRK will remain unchanged in its will to increase its military muscle and protect the country's sovereignty, national dignity and genuine international justice as long as the imperialists and hegemonic forces persist in their moves to stifle its socialist system.

articles.title: S. Korean People Declare Actions for Peaceful Future
articles.content:
S. Korean People Declare Actions for Peaceful Future
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and citizens of different social standings in south Korea held the first Wednesday rally for this year outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Jan. 4, according to the south Korean Internet newspaper Tongil News.
					 They denounced Park Geun Hye for denying her wrongdoings, far from owning full responsibility and making an apology for them.
					
					 They pledged to carry on their struggle for the repeal of the "agreement" on sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, the authorities' official apology, Japan's legal reparation and for peaceful future, a world free from war and violence.
					
					 A statement, made public at the rally, contended that the issue of sexual slavery should be settled as a human rights issue.

articles.title: Acting Chairman of KCTU Declares Anti-regime Action
articles.content:
Acting Chairman of KCTU Declares Anti-regime Action
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The acting chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions on New Year's Day made public an article declaring a more vigorous action to bring down the Park Geun Hye regime.
					 The article referred to the fact that a large number of angered people took part in the candlelight rallies in order to impeach the corrupt regime in 2016.
					
					 It appealed to the people to stage more dynamic candlelight actions so as to force the regime to step down, declaring that the Confederation would take the lead in the struggle against Park and her accomplices.

articles.title: Bird Flu Continues to Spread in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Continues to Spread in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Bird flu has been detected in different parts of south Korea in the new year, too, according to south Korean KBS.
					 According to examination of dead chicken on a farm in Rinje County of south Korean Kangwon Province on Jan. 3, they proved infected with the bird flu virus.
					
					 Some wild birds were found dead in other parts.

articles.title: Crackdown by Fascist Law Condemned in S. Korea
articles.content:
Crackdown by Fascist Law Condemned in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Members of organizations in south Korea called a press conference in Seoul on Jan. 5 in denunciation of the puppet authorities' crackdown on the representative of the "Worker's Book," according to the south Korean internet paper Chamsesang.
					 In July last year, the fascist police searched the house of the representative and confiscated books and the railway trade union's documents. And the puppet prosecution requested a warrant of arrest for the representative on charges of possession of "enemy-benefiting literature" this year.
					
					 Speakers at the conference charged the arrest of the representative as a "witch hunt" staged by Hwang Kyo An.
					
					 They stressed that such act should never be tolerated as suppression of freedom of political activities, thinking and expression by invoking an evil law.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Khabarovsk Territory Publishing House of Russia brought out in pamphlet "Making Selfless, Devoted Efforts for the Good of the People is the Mode of Existence and Source of Invincible Might of the Workers' Party of Korea", a work of Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on Dec. 29 last year to mark the 5th anniversary of his assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 The work, published on October 10, Juche 104 (2015), says that the history of the Workers' Party of Korea is a proud course in which it has led the Korean revolution to victory, being responsible for the people's destiny under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK's December Holidays Celebrated in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's December Holidays Celebrated in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to celebrate the 25th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA), the 5th anniversary of respected Marshal Kim Jong Un's assumption of KPA supreme commandership and the 99th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 Celebration meetings, seminars, lectures, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Bulgaria, Switzerland, Sweden and Tanzania between Dec. 15 and 30 last year.
					
					 On display at the venues of events were photos showing the revolutionary careers and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also there were their works and books and photos introducing the achievements made by the Korean people in building an economic power.
					
					 The chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee said that under the guidance of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il the DPRK victoriously concluded the Arduous March, Forced March in which the country had to overcome the biggest difficulties, and provided a springboard for building a thriving nation and developed into a satellite manufacturer and launcher and a military power possessed of self-defensive nuclear deterrent.
					
					 The chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association and the chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea stressed that in 2016 the DPRK fully demonstrated before the world its political and military might further increased under the guidance of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Tanzanian National Coordinating Committee of the Juche Idea Study Groups said in a lecture that Kim Jong Suk, deeply revered by the Korean people, had devoted her whole life to the struggle for the country and its people.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events in Bulgaria, Switzerland and Sweden.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Beninese Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Beninese Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Jan. 1 in support of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's New Year Address for 2017.
					 The statement said:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Un said in his New Year Address that all the Korean people in the north, the south and abroad should achieve solidarity, make concerted efforts and unite on the principle of subordinating everything to national reunification, the common cause of the nation, and revitalize the reunification movement on a nationwide scale.
					
					 We fully support his proposal for Korea's reunification.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not aggravate the situation by finding fault with the DPRK's exercise of the right to self-defence thoughtlessly, but respond positively to the latter's sincere efforts to prevent military conflict between north and south and ease the tension.
					
					 The Korean people will smash the challenge and disturbance by forces against reunification at home and abroad and bring a new phase of independent reunification under the guidance of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Representante coreano ante la ONU envia carta al secretario general de la ONU
articles.content:
Representante coreano ante la ONU envia carta al secretario general de la ONU
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- El representante permanente de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ante la ONU envio el dia 5 una carta al secretario general de esta organizacion para expresar la opinion sobre la carta de respuesta remitida por el subsecretario general de Asuntos Politicos por el encargo del ex secretario general de la ONU.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					Quisiera adelantar la conclusion de que la carta enviada por el subsecretario general de Asuntos Politicos no es la respuesta a mi pregunta sobre cual es el fundamento legal de las "resoluciones de sancion" del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, aprobadas en contra de las pruebas nucleares y el lanzamiento de satelites con fines pacificos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					En las cartas al ex secretario general de la ONU fechadas 23 de mayo y 5 de diciembre de 2016, respectivamente, yo pregunte si hay algun articulo en las leyes internacionales que haya estipulado que las pruebas nucleares y los lanzamientos de satelite y cohete balistico constituyen una "amenaza a la paz y seguridad internacionales" siendo el fundamento legal de las "resoluciones de sancion" del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU contra la RPDC.
					
					Sin embargo, el Secretariado de la ONU ha mencionado solo el articulo 39 del capitulo VII de la Carta de la ONU sin ninguna palabra de respuesta a mi pregunta.
					
					Como ya se ha discutido en el circulo juridico internacional, el articulo 39 de la Carta de la ONU no puede ser el fundamento legal de las "resoluciones de sancion".
					
					En 1966, cuando Rhodesia proclamo la independencia desde el regimen colonial de Gran Bretana, el Consejo de Seguridad adopto por primera vez en la historia de la ONU una "resolucion de sancion" aduciendo como fundamento legal el articulo 39 de la Carta de la ONU. Al respecto, el circulo juridico internacional lo califico de un acto de abuso del poder insistiendo en que la proclamacion de la independencia no es una amenaza o perturbacion de la paz.
					
					Hasta los elaboradores de la Carta de la ONU aclararon que ellos han ideado el articulo 39 teniendo en cuenta un acto de agresion, no para imponer sanciones en el tiempo de paz.
					
					Si la prueba nuclear o el lanzamiento de satelite y cohete balistico fuera considerada como "amenaza a la paz y seguridad internacionales" segun el articulo 39 de la Carta de la ONU, el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU debio haber cuestionado e impuesto sanciones a EE.UU. y otros paises que realizaron mas de 2 mil veces las pruebas nucleares y los lanzamientos de satelites y cohetes balisticos.
					
					Esto comprueba claramente que el articulo 39 de la Carta de la ONU no tiene nada que ver con la prueba nuclear o el lanzamiento de satelite.
					
					La fabricacion de las ilegales e inmorales "resoluciones de sancion" contra la RPDC y la imposicion de las sanciones del tipo de bloqueo que incluyen en su lista de blancos hasta los rifles, balas, arcos y flechas de uso deportivo son precisamente el acto contra la humanidad y civilizacion que amenaza gravemente el derecho a la vida de nuestro pueblo y destruye la civilizacion moderna para hacer al mundo entero volver a la oscura epoca medieval.
					
					La prueba de la bomba H, la de explosion de ojiva nuclear y el lanzamiento de ensayo de ICBM y otros medios de ataque devienen el ejercicio pleno del derecho legitimo estipulado en la Carta de la ONU siendo medidas de autodefensa para adquirir el disuasivo poderoso que pueda eliminar las fuentes de provocacion en el caso de que las fuerzas hostiles violen nuestra soberania y derecho a la existencia.
					
					Mientras EE.UU. y sus satelites mantengan la amenaza y chantaje nucleares y no dejen de realizar en nuestra nariz los ejercicios de guerra descritos por ellos como "anuales", se consolidara significativamente nuestra capacidad autodefensiva y la de ataque preventivo con fuerzas armadas nucleares como su eje.
					
					Espero que el Secretariado de la ONU cumpla con su responsabilidad asumida ante la sociedad internacional al considerar seriamente las cuestiones sobre el fundamento legal de las "resoluciones de sancion" anti-RPDC y dar respuestas imparciales a ellas en conformidad con la mision basica de la ONU para la paz y seguridad internacionales.

articles.title: PTC felicita el 105o aniversario de fundacion del Congreso Nacional Africano de Sudafrica
articles.content:
PTC felicita el 105o aniversario de fundacion del Congreso Nacional Africano de Sudafrica
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- En ocasion del 105o aniversario de la fundacion del Congreso Nacional Africano de Sudafrica (CNAS), el Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea remitio hoy un mensaje de felicitacion al Comite Ejecutivo Nacional de esa organizacion.
					La misiva recuerda que durante largo tiempo desde su fundacion, el CNAS condujo a la victoria la lucha del pueblo sudafricano contra el colonialismo y el apartheid. 
					
					  Convencido de que en lo adelante tambien, se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran conforme a los intereses de los pueblos de dos paises las relaciones de amistad entre el PTC y el CNAS establecidas en la lucha por la independencia antiimperialista, formula votos por mayores exitos en las tareas del CNAS para el desarrollo independiente y la prosperidad del pais.
